intro: Watsonamra donnell-smithii, commonly known as the Donnell-Smith's Watsonia, is a unique member of the Iridaceae family. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, grass-like leaves that form a rosette at the base. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
